metadata.name: stg_sittings
metadata.comment:
Provides detailed information about parliamentary sittings, including the date, time, session details, and volume associated with each sitting.

| Parliament Term | Session | Volume(s)  |   Start    |    End     |
| --------------- | ------- | ---------- | ---------- | ---------- |
| 12              | 1       | 89, 90, 91 | 2011-10-10 | 2014-04-15 |
| 12              | 2       | 92, 93     | 2014-05-16 | 2015-08-25 |
| 13              | 1       | 94         | 2016-01-15 | 2018-04-03 |
| 13              | 2       | 94         | 2018-05-07 | 2020-06-23 |
| 14              | 1       | 95         | 2020-08-24 | 2023-03-24 |
| 14              | 2       | 95         | 2023-04-10 | Present    |

Each row represents one sitting.

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_speeches
metadata.comment:
Contains information about speeches delivered in the Singapore Parliament, including details such as speech ID, date, topic ID, speech order, member name, and the text of the speech.

Each row represents one speech (speech_id).

speech_id.name: speech_id
speech_id.comment:
The 'Speech ID' is a unique identifier for each speech, providing a reference for easy identification.
It contains the date, the topic number, and the speech number (in running sequence).

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.comment: Shows the most likely topic classification by topic ID.

topic_id.name: topic_id
topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_topic_names
metadata.comment: Provides the summarised name (`topic_summary`) based on the top 15 words from the trained topic model. In addition, shows the top 15 words (`top_n_words`).

topic_group_id.name: topic_group_id
topic_group_id.comment:
Corresponds to the topic group number (ID) which is the result of a topic modelling.
For the list of topics, use the following query:

```sql
select
    topic as topic_group_id,
    topic_summary as topic_group_name,
    top_n_words
from `singapore-parliament-speeches.topic_modelling.topic_names_19_nmf_20240331`
order by topic_group_id
```

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

Provides information about parliamentary topics, including details such as topic ID, date, topic order, title, and section type.

topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

metadata.name: dash_by_member_metrics
metadata.comment:
Member-level metrics for speeches per sitting, attendance, participation, words per speech, readability score.
Observations are for each member within and across (all) parliaments. For use in Dash app.

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

member_party.name: member_party
member_party.comment:
The political party or designation of the member.

| Acronym |                 Party                 |
| ------- | ------------------------------------- |
| PAP     | People's Action Party                 |
| WP      | Workers' Party                        |
| PSP     | Progress Singapore Party              |
| SPP     | Singapore People's Party              |
| NCMP    | Non-Constituency Member of Parliament |

member_constituency.name: member_constituency
member_constituency.comment: Single-member Group-representative (SMC/GRC) Constituency which member represents.

parliament.name: parliament
parliament.comment:
Parliamentary term number. Each parliament meeting typically has two sessions.

|                              Parliamentary Term                               | Commencement | Prorogued  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------- |
| [12th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2011-10-10   | 2015-08-25 |
| [13th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2016-01-15   | 2020-06-23 |
| [14th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2020-08-24   | Present    |

questions_per_sitting.name: questions_per_sitting
questions_per_sitting.comment: Average number of parliamentary questions raised by a parliamentary member within or across all parliaments.

words_per_speech.name: words_per_speech
words_per_speech.comment: Average words per speech used by a parliamentary member within or across all parliaments.

speeches_per_sitting.name: speeches_per_sitting
speeches_per_sitting.comment: Average speeches per sitting used by a parliamentary member within or across all parliaments.

readability_score.name: readability_score
readability_score.comment:
Average readability score of a parliamentary member's speeches within or across all parliaments.
Readability calculated using Flesch-Kincaid index.

attendance.name: attendance
attendance.comment: Attendance of a parliamentary member within or across all parliaments.

participation.name: participation
participation.comment: Participation of a parliamentary member within or across all parliaments.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

|                              Parliamentary Term                               | Commencement | Prorogued  |

count_sittings_total.name: count_sittings_total

count_sittings_present.name: count_sittings_present
count_sittings_present.comment: Number of sittings the member attended.

count_sittings_spoken.name: count_sittings_spoken

count_pri_questions.name: count_pri_questions
count_pri_questions.comment: Number of primary questions (see is_primary_question for definition).

count_words.name: count_words
count_words.comment: Number of words within a given speech.

count_sentences.name: count_sentences
count_sentences.comment: Number of sentences in a given speech, where sentences are defined as continuous blocks of text ending with periods, question marks, or exclamation marks.

count_syllables.name: count_syllables
count_syllables.comment:
Number of syllables within a given speech.
Calculated using a heuristic method. See the [`count_syllables(word)`](https://github.com/jeremychia/singapore-parliament-speeches/blob/aab0ec3cf820a768c40e3a5ad22aa075640616d1/scripts/transform/speeches.py#L71C5-L71C20) function.

Provides detailed information about the attendance records of Members of Parliament (MPs) during various parliamentary sessions.

Each row represents a member's attendance on a given date.

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

is_present.name: is_present
is_present.comment: Boolean value. TRUE if member was present for that day's sitting. False otherwise.

metadata.name: fact_bill_activity
metadata.comment:
Provides reading (e.g. 'First Reading', 'Second Reading' etc.) activity by bill in an event (long) table format.

For how the reading (first, second, third) is distinguished, see the column documentation for 'reading'.

Each row represents a bill and corresponding activity.

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

topic_id.name: topic_id
topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

reading.name: reading
reading.comment:
'Reading' indicates the bill's stage.

| Reading  | Description                                                                                                    | Indicated By                           |
| -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| -------------------------------------- |
| 1 First  | Draft bill introduced, title read, MPs research.                                                             | Topic = 'BI'                          |
| 2 Second | General debate, vote, if passed, title read again (Second Reading).                                           | Topic = 'BP' and speeches ref 2nd reading |
| 3 Third  | Review, vote, and passage (Third Reading).                                                                   | Topic = 'BP' and speeches ref 3rd reading  |

title.name: title
title.comment: Name header of the parliamentary topic.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: fact_bills_introduced
metadata.comment:
From parliament website Provides information on bills. Information available:

* When the first, second, third reading for the respective bill was.

Each row represents one bill.

title.name: title
title.comment: Name header of the parliamentary topic.

first_reading_date.name: first_reading_date
first_reading_date.comment: The date bill was first introduced to parliament. Members will thereafter have time to read the bill. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

second_reading_date.name: second_reading_date
second_reading_date.comment: The date bill was subsequently introduced to parliament. This is typically when it is debated and/or amendments are proposed. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

passed_date.name: passed_date
passed_date.comment: The date bill was passed in parliament. Thereafter, needs President's Assent to become law. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

bill_pdf_link.name: bill_pdf_link
bill_pdf_link.comment: PDF of changes in the bill.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: fact_sittings
metadata.comment:
Contains information about speeches delivered in the Singapore Parliament, including details such as speech ID, date, topic ID, speech order, member name, and the text of the speech.

Each row represents one speech (speech_id).

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.comment: When a parliamentary sitting commenced for a given day.

parliament.name: parliament
parliament.comment:
Parliamentary term number. Each parliament meeting typically has two sessions.

|                              Parliamentary Term                               | Commencement | Prorogued  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------- |
| [12th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2011-10-10   | 2015-08-25 |
| [13th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2016-01-15   | 2020-06-23 |
| [14th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2020-08-24   | Present    |

volume.name: volume
volume.comment:
'Volume' represents the volume number associated with the parliamentary sitting. There are a possibly a few volumes per parliamentary session.

| volume | parliament | session |
|--------|------------|---------|
| 89     | 12         | 1       |
| 90     | 12         | 1       |
| 91     | 12         | 1       |
| 92     | 12         | 2       |
| 93     | 12         | 2       |
| 94     | 13         | 1       |
| 94     | 13         | 2       |
| 95     | 14         | 1       |
| 95     | 14         | 2       |

sittings.name: sittings
sittings.comment: Order of sittings conducted during a particular parliamentary session. This is expected to be in a running sequence.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: fact_speeches
metadata.comment:
Contains information about speeches delivered in the Singapore Parliament, including details such as speech ID, date, topic ID, speech order, member name, and the text of the speech.

Each row represents one speech (speech_id).

speech_id.name: speech_id
speech_id.comment:
The 'Speech ID' is a unique identifier for each speech, providing a reference for easy identification.
It contains the date, the topic number, and the speech number (in running sequence).

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

topic_id.name: topic_id
topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

speech_order.name: speech_order
speech_order.comment: Order in which the speech was delivered during the sitting.

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

text.name: text
text.comment: Contains the raw content of the speech delivered in Parliament.

count_words.name: count_words
count_words.comment: Number of words within a given speech.

count_characters.name: count_characters
count_characters.comment: Number of alphabetic characters within a given speech.

count_sentences.name: count_sentences
count_sentences.comment: Number of sentences in a given speech, where sentences are defined as continuous blocks of text ending with periods, question marks, or exclamation marks.

count_syllables.name: count_syllables
count_syllables.comment:
Number of syllables within a given speech.
Calculated using a heuristic method. See the [`count_syllables(word)`](https://github.com/jeremychia/singapore-parliament-speeches/blob/aab0ec3cf820a768c40e3a5ad22aa075640616d1/scripts/transform/speeches.py#L71C5-L71C20) function.

is_vernacular_speech.name: is_vernacular_speech
is_vernacular_speech.comment: Boolean value. TRUE if speeches contains phrase "vernacular speech". False otherwise.

vernacular_speech_language.name: vernacular_speech_language
vernacular_speech_language.comment:
Language of the vernacular speech.

Extracts "mandarin", "malay", or "tamil" where "vernacular speech" appears in the raw text, otherwise NULL.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: dim_members
metadata.comment:
Provides information about members of the parliament, including details such as member name, party affiliation, gender, earliest sitting, latest sitting, count of sittings present, and count of total sittings.

Each row represents one Member of Parliament (MP).

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

member_ethnicity.name: member_ethnicity
member_ethnicity.comment: Ethnicity of the member (Chinese, Malay, Indian, or Others).

gender.name: gender
gender.comment: Gender of the member (M for Male, F for Female).

party.name: party
party.comment:
The political party or designation of the member.

| Acronym |                 Party                 |
| ------- | ------------------------------------- |
| PAP     | People's Action Party                 |
| WP      | Workers' Party                        |
| PSP     | Progress Singapore Party              |
| SPP     | Singapore People's Party              |
| NCMP    | Non-Constituency Member of Parliament |

member_constituencies.type: ARRAY<STRUCT<member_position STRING, effective_from_date DATE, effective_to_date DATE>>
member_constituencies.name: member_constituencies
member_constituencies.comment: Single-member Group-representative (SMC/GRC) Constituency which member represents.

latest_member_constituency.name: latest_member_constituency
latest_member_constituency.comment: Current or last (for former MPs) constitutency represented.

member_appointments.type: ARRAY<STRUCT<member_position STRING, effective_from_date DATE, effective_to_date DATE>>
member_appointments.name: member_appointments

latest_member_appointments.name: latest_member_appointments
latest_member_appointments.comment: Current or last (for former MPs) political appointment(s).

member_committees.type: ARRAY<STRUCT<member_position STRING, effective_from_date DATE, effective_to_date DATE>>
member_committees.name: member_committees

latest_member_committees.name: latest_member_committees
latest_member_committees.comment: Current or last (for former MPs) parliamentary committee membership(s).

earliest_sitting.name: earliest_sitting
earliest_sitting.comment:
Member's earliest recorded parliamentary sitting 
Note: The earliest sitting in this dataset is 2012-09-10.

count_sittings_present.name: count_sittings_present
count_sittings_present.comment: Number of sittings the member attended.

count_sittings_total.name: count_sittings_total
count_sittings_total.comment: Number of parliamentary sittings during which the member was eligible to participate.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: dim_topics
metadata.comment:
Provides information about parliamentary topics, including details such as topic ID, date, topic order, title, and section type.
 
Each row represents one topic (topic_id).

topic_id.name: topic_id
topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

topic_order.name: topic_order
topic_order.comment: Order in which the topic was debated during the sitting.

title.name: title
title.comment: Name header of the parliamentary topic.

section_type.name: section_type
section_type.comment:
Section type associated with the topic.

'Section Type Name' indicates the full name of the section.

| Acronym | Section Type Name                                                               |
|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BI      | Bill Introduced                                                                 |
| BP      | Second or Third Reading Bills                                                   |
| OA      | Oral Answers to Questions                                                       |
| OS      | Oral Statement                                                                  |
| WA      | Written Answers to Questions                                                    |
| WS      | Correction by Written Statements                                                |
| WANA    | Written Answer to Question for Oral Answer not Answered by End of Question Time |

section_type_name.name: section_type_name
section_type_name.comment:
Section type associated with the topic.

'Section Type Name' indicates the full name of the section.

| Acronym | Section Type Name                                                               |
|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BI      | Bill Introduced                                                                 |
| BP      | Second or Third Reading Bills                                                   |
| OA      | Oral Answers to Questions                                                       |
| OS      | Oral Statement                                                                  |
| WA      | Written Answers to Questions                                                    |
| WS      | Correction by Written Statements                                                |
| WANA    | Written Answer to Question for Oral Answer not Answered by End of Question Time |

topic_group_id.name: topic_group_id
topic_group_id.comment:
Corresponds to the topic group number (ID) which is the result of a topic modelling.
For the list of topics, use the following query:

```sql
select
    topic as topic_group_id,
    topic_summary as topic_group_name,
    top_n_words
from `singapore-parliament-speeches.topic_modelling.topic_names_19_nmf_20240331`
order by topic_group_id
```

topic_group_name.name: topic_group_name
topic_group_name.comment:
Corresponds to the topic group's name, which is derived, using an LLM, from the top n words.
For the list of topics, use the following query:

```sql
select
    topic as topic_group_id,
    topic_summary as topic_group_name,
    top_n_words
from `singapore-parliament-speeches.topic_modelling.topic_names_19_nmf_20240331`
order by topic_group_id
```

topic_group_distribution.name: topic_group_distribution
topic_group_distribution.comment:
When topic modelling is done, probabilities are assigned to each topic to ascertain what is the likelihood the topic belongs to a category.
Topic group distribution refers to the probability that the given topic belongs to the highest group.

For the list of topics, use the following query:

```sql
select
    topic as topic_group_id,
    topic_summary as topic_group_name,
    top_n_words
from `singapore-parliament-speeches.topic_modelling.topic_names_19_nmf_20240331`
order by topic_group_id
```

is_topic_constitutional.name: is_topic_constitutional
is_topic_constitutional.comment:
Boolean value. TRUE if topic concerns a constitution amendment. False otherwise.

This applies only if:

* The topic is was bill introduced ("BI") or bill in second or third reading ("BP").
* The topic contains the word "Constitution".

Typical examples of topic names which qualify are:

* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment) Bill
* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment No 2) Bill
* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment No 3) Bill

is_topic_procedural.name: is_topic_procedural
is_topic_procedural.comment:
Boolean value. TRUE if topic concerns a procedural statement, and therefore should be considered excluded from the speech count. False otherwise.

This applies only if:

* The topic is bill introduced ("BI")
* The topic is correction by written statements ("WS")

metadata.comment:
Long table of member's constitutency, appointments, and select committee participation.
Identify the difference by 'type'.

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

type.name: type
type.comment: Refers to the constitutency, political appointment (position), or select committee participation (select committee).

member_position.name: member_position
member_position.comment: Constitutency, political appointment, or select committee participation.

effective_from_date.name: effective_from_date
effective_from_date.comment: Date which the appointment is effective from. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD

effective_to_date.name: effective_to_date
effective_to_date.comment: Date which the appointment is effective to. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD

is_latest_position.name: is_latest_position
is_latest_position.comment: Boolean value. True if the MP is currently holding this appointment, or if this was the last appointment the MP held before stepping down. False otherwise.

metadata.name: mart_attendance
metadata.comment:
Provides detailed information about the attendance records of Members of Parliament (MPs) during various parliamentary sessions.

Each row represents a member's attendance on a given date.

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

parliament.name: parliament
parliament.comment:
Parliamentary term number. Each parliament meeting typically has two sessions.

|                              Parliamentary Term                               | Commencement | Prorogued  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------- |
| [12th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2011-10-10   | 2015-08-25 |
| [13th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2016-01-15   | 2020-06-23 |
| [14th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2020-08-24   | Present    |

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

member_gender.name: member_gender
member_gender.comment: Gender of the member (M for Male, F for Female).

member_ethnicity.name: member_ethnicity
member_ethnicity.comment: Ethnicity of the member (Chinese, Malay, Indian, or Others).

member_constituency.name: member_constituency
member_constituency.comment: Single-member Group-representative (SMC/GRC) Constituency which member represents.

is_present.name: is_present
is_present.comment: Boolean value. TRUE if member was present for that day's sitting. False otherwise.

num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: mart_bills
metadata.comment:
Provides information on bills. Information available:

* When the first, second, third reading for the respective bill was.

Each row represents one bill.

year.name: year
year.comment: Year parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered.

title.name: title
title.comment: Name header of the parliamentary topic.

first_reading_date.name: first_reading_date
first_reading_date.comment: The date bill was first introduced to parliament. Members will thereafter have time to read the bill. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

first_reading_topic.name: first_reading_topic
first_reading_topic.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.. Correpsonds to that of the first reading.

second_reading_date.name: second_reading_date
second_reading_date.comment: The date bill was subsequently introduced to parliament. This is typically when it is debated and/or amendments are proposed. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

second_reading_topic.name: second_reading_topic
second_reading_topic.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.. Correpsonds to that of the second reading.

third_reading_date.name: third_reading_date
third_reading_date.comment: The date bill was read for the third time to parliament. This is typically when there are amendments. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

third_reading_topic.name: third_reading_topic
third_reading_topic.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.. Correpsonds to that of the third reading, if applicable.

passed_date.name: passed_date
passed_date.comment: The date bill was passed in parliament. Thereafter, needs President's Assent to become law. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

day_diff_first_second_reading.name: day_diff_first_second_reading
day_diff_first_second_reading.comment: Difference in days between first_reading_date and second_reading_date.

day_diff_second_third_reading.name: day_diff_second_third_reading
day_diff_second_third_reading.comment: Difference in days between second_reading_date and third_reading_date (usually 0).

day_diff_third_reading_passed.name: day_diff_third_reading_passed
day_diff_third_reading_passed.comment: Difference in days between third_reading_date and passed_date.

bill_pdf_link.name: bill_pdf_link
bill_pdf_link.comment: PDF of changes in the bill.

num_bytes.label: Approximate Size
num_bytes.description: Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery

num_rows.label: # Rows
num_rows.description: Approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: mart_speeches
metadata.comment:
Contains information about speeches delivered in the Singapore Parliament, including details such as speech ID, date, topic ID, speech order, member name, and the text of the speech.

Each row represents one speech (speech_id).

date.name: date
date.comment: When parliamentary sitting had happened or when the speech was delivered. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

speech_id.name: speech_id
speech_id.comment:
The 'Speech ID' is a unique identifier for each speech, providing a reference for easy identification.
It contains the date, the topic number, and the speech number (in running sequence).

topic_id.name: topic_id
topic_id.comment: Unique identifier for the topic or subject matter associated with the speech.

parliament.name: parliament
parliament.comment:
Parliamentary term number. Each parliament meeting typically has two sessions.

|                              Parliamentary Term                               | Commencement | Prorogued  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------- |
| [12th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2011-10-10   | 2015-08-25 |
| [13th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2016-01-15   | 2020-06-23 |
| [14th Parliament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Parliament_of_Singapore) | 2020-08-24   | Present    |

volume.name: volume
volume.comment:
'Volume' represents the volume number associated with the parliamentary sitting. There are a possibly a few volumes per parliamentary session.

| volume | parliament | session |
|--------|------------|---------|
| 89     | 12         | 1       |
| 90     | 12         | 1       |
| 91     | 12         | 1       |
| 92     | 12         | 2       |
| 93     | 12         | 2       |
| 94     | 13         | 1       |
| 94     | 13         | 2       |
| 95     | 14         | 1       |
| 95     | 14         | 2       |

sittings.name: sittings
sittings.comment: Order of sittings conducted during a particular parliamentary session. This is expected to be in a running sequence.

member_name.name: member_name
member_name.comment: Full name of the Member of Parliament (MP) whose attendance is being recorded.

member_gender.name: member_gender
member_gender.comment: Gender of the member (M for Male, F for Female).

member_ethnicity.name: member_ethnicity
member_ethnicity.comment: Ethnicity of the member (Chinese, Malay, Indian, or Others).

member_party.name: member_party
member_party.comment:
The political party or designation of the member.

| Acronym |                 Party                 |
| ------- | ------------------------------------- |
| PAP     | People's Action Party                 |
| WP      | Workers' Party                        |
| PSP     | Progress Singapore Party              |
| SPP     | Singapore People's Party              |
| NCMP    | Non-Constituency Member of Parliament |

member_constituency.name: member_constituency
member_constituency.comment: Single-member Group-representative (SMC/GRC) Constituency which member represents.

member_count_concurrent_appointments.name: member_count_concurrent_appointments
member_count_concurrent_appointments.comment: Number of concurrent political appointments at any one point in time.

topic_title.name: topic_title
topic_title.comment: Name header of the parliamentary topic.

topic_type.name: topic_type
topic_type.comment:
Section type associated with the topic.

'Section Type Name' indicates the full name of the section.

| Acronym | Section Type Name                                                               |
|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BI      | Bill Introduced                                                                 |
| BP      | Second or Third Reading Bills                                                   |
| OA      | Oral Answers to Questions                                                       |
| OS      | Oral Statement                                                                  |
| WA      | Written Answers to Questions                                                    |
| WS      | Correction by Written Statements                                                |
| WANA    | Written Answer to Question for Oral Answer not Answered by End of Question Time |

topic_type_name.name: topic_type_name
topic_type_name.comment:
Section type associated with the topic.

'Section Type Name' indicates the full name of the section.

| Acronym | Section Type Name                                                               |
|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BI      | Bill Introduced                                                                 |
| BP      | Second or Third Reading Bills                                                   |
| OA      | Oral Answers to Questions                                                       |
| OS      | Oral Statement                                                                  |
| WA      | Written Answers to Questions                                                    |
| WS      | Correction by Written Statements                                                |
| WANA    | Written Answer to Question for Oral Answer not Answered by End of Question Time |

is_topic_constitutional.name: is_topic_constitutional
is_topic_constitutional.comment:
Boolean value. TRUE if topic concerns a constitution amendment. False otherwise.

This applies only if:

* The topic is was bill introduced ("BI") or bill in second or third reading ("BP").
* The topic contains the word "Constitution".

Typical examples of topic names which qualify are:

* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment) Bill
* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment No 2) Bill
* Constitution of the Republic of Singapore (Amendment No 3) Bill

is_topic_procedural.name: is_topic_procedural
is_topic_procedural.comment:
Boolean value. TRUE if topic concerns a procedural statement, and therefore should be considered excluded from the speech count. False otherwise.

This applies only if:

* The topic is bill introduced ("BI")
* The topic is correction by written statements ("WS")

speech_text.name: speech_text
speech_text.comment: Contains the raw content of the speech delivered in Parliament.

count_speeches_words.name: count_speeches_words
count_speeches_words.comment: Number of words within a given speech.

count_speeches_characters.name: count_speeches_characters
count_speeches_characters.comment: Number of alphabetic characters within a given speech.

count_speeches_sentences.name: count_speeches_sentences
count_speeches_sentences.comment: Number of sentences in a given speech, where sentences are defined as continuous blocks of text ending with periods, question marks, or exclamation marks.

count_speeches_syllables.name: count_speeches_syllables
count_speeches_syllables.comment:
Number of syllables within a given speech.
Calculated using a heuristic method. See the [`count_syllables(word)`](https://github.com/jeremychia/singapore-parliament-speeches/blob/aab0ec3cf820a768c40e3a5ad22aa075640616d1/scripts/transform/speeches.py#L71C5-L71C20) function.

is_vernacular_speech.name: is_vernacular_speech
is_vernacular_speech.comment: Boolean value. TRUE if speeches contains phrase "vernacular speech". False otherwise.

vernacular_speech_language.name: vernacular_speech_language
vernacular_speech_language.comment:
Language of the vernacular speech.

Extracts "mandarin", "malay", or "tamil" where "vernacular speech" appears in the raw text, otherwise NULL.

is_primary_question.name: is_primary_question
is_primary_question.comment:
Boolean value. TRUE if was a parliamentary question posed. False otherwise.

Derived from first looking at: 
* Written Answers to Questions (WA), Written Answer to Question for Oral Answer not Answered by End of Question Time (WANA), or Oral Answers to Questions (OA).
* Where question was asked to a political office holder.

ministry_addressed.name: ministry_addressed
ministry_addressed.comment: Ministry which question was addressed to, derived from which minister the question was addressed to.

ministry_addressed_primary.name: ministry_addressed_primary
ministry_addressed_primary.comment: The primary ministry addressed within a given topic given by proportion.

ministry_proportion_primary.name: ministry_proportion_primary
ministry_proportion_primary.comment: The proportion the primary ministry appears within a topic.

ministry_addressed_secondary.name: ministry_addressed_secondary
ministry_addressed_secondary.comment: The secondary ministry addressed within a given topic given by proportion.

ministry_proportion_secondary.name: ministry_proportion_secondary
ministry_proportion_secondary.comment: The proportion the secondary ministry appears within a topic.
